name: networkx
summary: Python package for creating and manipulating graphs and networks

chunks.text:
NetworkX
========

.. image::

.. image::

.. image::

.. image::

.. image::

.. image::

NetworkX is a Python package for the creation, manipulation,
and study of the structure, dynamics, and functions
of complex networks.

Simple example
--------------

Find the shortest path between two nodes in an undirected graph:

.. code:: pycon

Install
-------

Install the latest released version of NetworkX:

.. code:: shell

Install with all optional dependencies:

.. code:: shell

For additional details,
please see the `installation guide `_.

Bugs
----

Please report any bugs that you find `here `_.
Or, even better, fork the repository on `GitHub `_
and create a pull request (PR). We welcome all changes, big or small, and we
will help you make the PR if you are new to `git` (just ask on the issue and/or
see the `contributor guide `_).

License
-------

Released under the `3-clause BSD license `_::

usage_description: This library is used to create, manipulate, and study complex networks with features such as finding shortest paths between nodes. This allows developers to efficiently analyze and visualize network structures and behaviors in various applications, including graph theory research, data analysis, and network optimization.
